Name: LG-VS-BAUM-101
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: Baum Revision Team, It is now 48 hours after the fire and extensive damage incurred. Absolutely no information has been provided to our team, no assistance with clean up to restore our normal business
Email RTF:
Baum Revision Team,

It is now 48 hours after the fire and extensive damage incurred. Absolutely no information has been provided to our team, no assistance with clean up to restore our normal business operations, and no response form management aside

from the emails including false information to the rest of the building via Rachel trying to cover Baum’s tracks for negligence.

We have now incurred further client loss and missed shipments due to inability to operate out of our warehousing & fulfillment center. We will continue to let these damages compound and rest assure we are seeking the absolute highest level of recourse against both Baum Revisions, Matthews Roofing, and any parties involved in our repeated nightmare of an experience in your establishment.

Additionally, we have the support of several other 4200 tenants and will continue to compile documentation of further tenants in support, their experiences, damages, and concerns of negligence to proceed with filing suit containing multiple plaintiffs.

As one of the partners of Chance The Rapper’s Social Works program was on-site at the time of the fire and needed to be escorted out for safety concerns, both Social Works, CTR, and a long list of of clients affected by the on-going issues with Baum Revisions are now in support of utilizing our collective news outlets, media contacts, and whatever means necessary to disclose how Rowboat Creative has been deeply and repeatedly impacted by Baum Revisions.

Many of the damaged items are that of Chance’s Social Work’s program in conjunction with Champion Sportswear and CPS. All parties are solidified supporters and partners of Rowboat Creative, with extensive media reach, and have committed to assist in anyway we see fit and necessary.

Lastly, David I will add that it is absolutely beyond me that you do not have enough compassion and professionalism to confront the situation whatsoever in person. Joe and I have built our business for 12 years with levels of hard work

and dedication I believe you know nothing about. Our business has been compromised time after time since ever coming in contact with you, Mark, and the entire Baum Revisions team. I can safely say that our experience with you and Baum Revisions has been the absolute worst thing we have collectively experienced in business. I would have expected more from an established business owner, but unfortunately the word the circulates in Chicago about other’s experiences further support our experiences and sentiments. We take pride in reputation we have built, standing behind our words and will stop at nothing to uphold our vision and direction. Most of all, we believe in being good people. It is more than a shame that this piece of the puzzle is amiss for you.

We are just getting started.

Lucas Guariglia

cell: 847.828.0944

office: 773.675.BOAT (2628)

president | designer | director of sales operations

Rowboat Creative

custom screen printing | embroidery | merchandising

ASI: 83710

www.rowboatcreative.com

Name: LG-VS-BAUM-103
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: I hear you loud and clear and take all of this very seriously. Your slander and threats are not going to be accepted and must cease immediately. When the fire occurred, I was on an airplane, and
Email RTF:
I hear you loud and clear and take all of this very seriously. Your slander and threats are not going to be accepted and must cease immediately.

When the fire occurred, I was on an airplane, and connected with my team within hours of the event. I immediately had a call with our insurance advisor saying we need an expert adjuster on our side to protect our tenant. This adjuster has been engaged to act in our collective best interest when dealing with Matthews and their insurance carrier. That adjuster will be on site Monday and will need access to your space. You are welcome to be there. You can also obviously retain your own expert. I also texted Joe at 4:16 pm on Thursday (time stamped

and shown as delivered on my phone) with the following: "Do you and Lucas have time for a quick call?" I too, was terribly upset about the fire, and I was surprised not to hear back from one or both of you, but thought maybe you needed a bit of time. I did not sleep that night because of the day’s events, so I can understand that you are upset as well.

The next day, however, instead of return text or call from either of you, I receive a series of slanderous emails. You have every right to be upset, but this in no way gives you license to send these emails, verbally threaten my colleagues, or badmouth my team. Your emails are personal. You are encouraging others to interfere with my business relationships and to speak negatively about my business operations. This is in direct violation of your lease and this is all despite the fact that my property management team was at the building when and after the fire happened and has been communicating with all tenants about the fire. Matthews roofing crew cleaned up the water and roof debris in your space right after the incident.

Matthews is a reputable roofing company that was hired to resolve issues at your space. Our intent in hiring them was obviously to solve a problem. You baselessly alleging negligence where there is none does not move this dialogue

forward. Baum has not been negligent or in breach of its lease obligations in any capacity.

However, your actions are a clear default of your lease. We will take all necessary steps to defend against this malice and these disparaging statements which are clearly intended to harm my business.
notes: Unreal. JZ has to meet with David to negotiate RBC staying in 4200 W. Diversey building.

Name: LG-VS-BAUM-104
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: Looks like little Davey's feelings are hurt. We have not coerced anyone to interfere or speak poorly about Baum. They are doing it themselves and very willingly. In fact, another tenant was the one
Email RTF:
Looks like little Davey’s feelings are hurt.

We have not coerced anyone to interfere or speak poorly about Baum. They are doing it themselves and very willingly. In fact, another tenant was the one verbally stating to Rachel to take it as a direct threat that she will be calling the city.

​

I have screenshots of David being the first one called directly after 911. A voicemail was left to call me immediately. Return call was never received. He is more interested in battling lease semantics as opposed to admitting fault with absolutely no reference as to why the sprinkler system has malfunctioned

once before and now failed to operate in an actually fire.

Debris was not cleaned up as it is an absolute disaster still with a large lake of water still present yesterday.

I will now personally disengage from direct contact with the little man but would like to add that he is now threatening me and making claims and false accusations. I believe I have every right to respond to emails containing false information and providing a clear picture to any tenant of what occurred. At

this point I will be happy to file a personal lawsuit against him as well.

My thoughts are that you should be present for any meetings at the space. If he has intent to claim we are in breach of our lease with possibility of trying to remove us from the building I say we move ahead with Tom showing his teeth.

Thoughts?
notes: This is the real Lucas Guariglia.

Name: LG-VS-BAUM-106
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: Pam- I have been told the insurance adjuster will be at the building at 10:30 am today. Rowboat is welcome to be involved in all steps of the process. If Rowboat has not already done so, it is
Email RTF:
Pam-

I have been told the insurance adjuster will be at the building at 10:30 am today. Rowboat is welcome to be involved in all steps of the process. If Rowboat has not already done so, it is extremely important that they get their insurance company involved immediately as well. Matthew’s Roofing insurance

certificate is attached for reference and I have requested the claim number be forwarded to me (which I will forward when I receive) but please be sure to forward me Rowboat’s insurance company contact info so I can also work on getting all of the necessary parties connected.

The water and debris was cleaned up by Matthews on Thursday, however, your client’s insurance company needs go out there and document any damage in the premises and to their items. In that vein, David contacted your clients on

Thursday to offer support and advice in regard to this, but to date, they have not called him back. He remains open to speaking with them.

I do not have any information on timing, but when I do, I will advise.

Thank you-

Tali

Name: LG-VS-BAUM-116
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: Hi Pam: As you know, David and Rachel were both at the building yesterday (10/15/18) and met with the adjuster sent out by our insurance company. During that meeting, David was not satisfied with that
Email RTF:
Hi Pam:

As you know, David and Rachel were both at the building yesterday (10/15/18) and

met with the adjuster sent out by our insurance company. During that meeting,

David was not satisfied with that individual’s responses, so our insurer is in

the process of dispatching a new adjuster to further assess the damage at the

property. As soon as we have a time for this visit, we will let tenant know.

In the meantime, we are also trying to work on the clean-up of the space. Today

(10/16/18), Rachel met with a representative from Illinois Board Up at the

space. I understand your client contacted Musick Loss Management Inc., who was

also present with them. The parties discussed the restoration and cleaning work

and both contractors advised that the certain of the clean-up work cannot

commence until Rowboat moves its personal property. Moving these items is

Rowboat’s responsibility. I assume Rowboat would be able to submit their

invoices to the insurance company for reimbursement for the cost of same, but

the moving of these items must be contracted for and done by Rowboat.

However, as was reiterated by the two contractors today (and as I advised

yesterday in my email to you, and as David advised yesterday) before Rowboat

moves anything, it is in your client’s best interest that their own insurance

adjuster come and assess their damage before things get moved. From what I

understand, Rowboat’s insurer has not yet sent an adjuster to the property. Can

you advise when this will happen? Or if no such adjuster is coming, please let

us know that fact as well.

Please send me Rowboat’s COI and contact info as soon as possible. It seems to

me that all three insurance companies (Matthew’s, Rowboat’s, and Landlord’s)

should be in contact with each other and coordinating. If you would like, we

can put your insurer in touch with our insurer directly. Our insurance agent

has advised that he is happy coordinate with all three insurers and do whatever

is necessary to streamline the process. If you do not want them to coordinate,

that’s fine too, just please let me know, but in all events, please forward the

COI.

Finally, as I’m sure you can appreciate, in order to get the restoration work in

place, contractors will be coming into the space. Joe and Lucas are welcome to

be there at every step of the way, and we certainly don’t want to inconvenience

them, but sometimes contractors will be late. We don’t control their schedules

and are likely going to be dealing with these issues during this process.

Thanks –

Tali

Body Snippet: Pam- I have been told that yesterday (10/17/18), Rachel was at the property for additional meetings related to the fire. The first meeting was with Landlord's insurance company adjuster. The second
Email RTF:
Pam-

I have been told that yesterday (10/17/18), Rachel was at the property for

additional meetings related to the fire. The first meeting was with Landlord’s

insurance company adjuster. The second meeting was with Lucas and Joe from

Rowboat, two individuals from an insurance company (TJ and Tim - but we don't

know last names or which insurance company,) and two fire marshalls (Inspector

Sawe and Inspector Rolfe).

At this second meeting, Rachel was advised that: 1) Rowboat is not going to be

requesting that an insurance adjuster come to the property on Rowboat’s behalf

to inspect the damage to their property, and 2) that Rowboat will not be filing

a first party insurance claim. To reiterate, we have been advised and are

sharing with you again that it is in Rowboat’s best interest to have an

insurance company involved and coordinating with the other insurance companies

>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Dear Tali and Baum Team,
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> As you are all aware, there was a fire at the property yesterday which stemmed from the negligence of Baum's roofing contractor and continued to progress based on Baum's negligence to maintain the building. One would think that a fire on the premises itself would be the most concerning part of what occurred, however, in this case the most concerning part was that there were no fire alarms and no sprinklers. My clients only became aware of the fire when they smelled it and it and ash began closing into their space. Then, Lucas from Rowboat was actually the person who called 911, NOT the roofers whom caused the fire and were already made aware of it. Had my clients not called 911 it is likely much more damage would have occurred including a potential building explosion given the adjacent tenant Letherbee Distillery.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> That being said, you can imagine Rowboat and its clients are infuriated. Not only has my clients space been damaged, shipments were missed yesterday as employees were unable to work in the environment, they cannot operate at their facility, their clients products have been damaged, and their clients are actually firing them. Moreover, my clients lives and the lives of their employees were put at risk along with the rest of the building. My clients have both video and pictures of burning debris falling into their unit while no fire alarms or sprinklers were going off, burning embers falling from the ceiling and burner Joe’s face as a result of roofers trying to merely stomp the fire out, and more that we will withhold for our case. It should be noted that the fire was not more than mere feet from a sprinkler head. Baum is clearly in violation of the building code for failing to provide a working fire alarm, failing to provide working sprinklers, and failing to properly install fire doors with operable exit signs, as the firefighters could not find the signs through the smoke. Though a reasonable person would assume such an egregious situation could be easily handled without litigation, given Baum's constant refusal to take responsibility for its actions and our history it seems litigation is inevitable. Rowboat’s litigation attorney’s have been contacted as we continue to prepare to pursue action to the utmost degree against not only Matthew’s Roofing but also Baum Revisions.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> At this time, we demand that documentation regarding all previous City Inspections, Fire Inspections and fire alarms be provided immediately. Further, we expect our space to be restored immediately, with no cost to us, and damages for all the product, machinery, and furniture paid immediately upon request. It is now 3:30pm with no insurance adjusters arriving on-site as Rowboat was told multiple times they would today. My clients have been forced to show clients the extent of the damage and are now fielding call after call as to reparations.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Lastly, it seems we will be losing some very large clients based on Baum's reluctance to properly maintain a building as landlords. You will be advised of those relationships and the lost income shortly, as Baum's negligence is the sole reason these relationships are being terminated.

it does not state the coverage is primary and non-contributory... We need

requirements immediately and please also provide evidence that this insurance

has been in place since lease execution.

Thank you.

Tali

Name: LG-VS-BAUM-140
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: Hi Lucas and Joe, A Emergency Services and Restoration performed cleaning work in the cleared out area in the south end of 23B Friday night, Saturday, Sunday and they finished cleaning that area this
Email RTF:
Hi Lucas and Joe,

A Emergency Services and Restoration performed cleaning work in the cleared out

area in the south end of 23B Friday night, Saturday, Sunday and they finished

cleaning that area this morning. I understand, however, that the balance of

Rowboat's other personal items have not yet been moved out by Servpro in the

additional areas that need to be cleaned. A Emergency Services cannot continue

working until this additional personal property is moved. Please let me know a

timeline for when Servpro will be done moving those items so I can coordinate

with A Emergency Services and give them proper notice to resume their work.

Please communicate the timeline directly with me (not with Mike) as I am

coordinating with the restoration company.

Also, this Friday morning we are changing out four of the system 5 sprinkler

heads that were located in the area of the fire. You are welcome to be present

during this work. Please let me know if you have any questions. Looking forward

to hearing from you soon regarding when the rest of your items will be moved.

Kind Regards,

Name: LG-VS-BAUM-143
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: All, As I responded to Rachel's previous email I would prefer if the following of sorts came from Pam and Tom: Tom: Please feel free to add any notes and items you see fit that should be tended to
Email RTF:
All,

As I responded to Rachel’s previous email I would prefer if the following of

sorts came from Pam and Tom:

Tom: Please feel free to add any notes and items you see fit that should be

tended to on this situation.

• We requested that a 3rd party (other than Great Lakes) inspect the entire fire

system throughout the building including the heads that should have deployed in

the fire. Why has this not been done yet?

• Why are the heads being replaced? Will the rest of the building be replaced?

• Can a report of every head being tested in the building be provided?

• Is there a scheduled time that the City of Chicago’s fire system inspection

team will be out as noted by Inspector Sawe and Rolfe upon their on-site

meeting?

• What is completion date for all fire code violations that were noted by

Inspector Sawe and Rolfe?

I would prefer that the heads not be changed by Great Lakes while they end up

disposing of the faulty heads or deeming them functional. I think that it is

extremely shady there is more going on behind the scenes between Great Lakes and

Baum that likely covers both their asses in this situation.

I will be traveling today so difficult to communicate but will be checking

between and after flights. I would like to get this on Baum’s radar asap.

Please let me know thoughts.

--

Lucas Guariglia

>>>>>>>>> As you are all aware, there was a fire at the property yesterday
>>>>>>>>> which stemmed from the negligence of Baum's roofing contractor and
>>>>>>>>> continued to progress based on Baum's negligence to maintain the building.
>>>>>>>>> One would think that a fire on the premises itself would be the most
>>>>>>>>> concerning part of what occurred, however, in this case the most concerning
>>>>>>>>> part was that there were no fire alarms and no sprinklers. My clients only
>>>>>>>>> became aware of the fire when they smelled it and it and ash began closing
>>>>>>>>> into their space. Then, Lucas from Rowboat was actually the person who
>>>>>>>>> called 911, NOT the roofers whom caused the fire and were already made
>>>>>>>>> aware of it. Had my clients not called 911 it is likely much more damage
>>>>>>>>> would have occurred including a potential building explosion given the
>>>>>>>>> adjacent tenant Letherbee Distillery.
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> That being said, you can imagine Rowboat and its clients are
>>>>>>>>> infuriated. Not only has my clients space been damaged, shipments were
>>>>>>>>> missed yesterday as employees were unable to work in the environment, they
>>>>>>>>> cannot operate at their facility, their clients products have been damaged,
>>>>>>>>> and their clients are actually firing them. Moreover, my clients lives and
>>>>>>>>> the lives of their employees were put at risk along with the rest of the
>>>>>>>>> building. My clients have both video and pictures of burning debris
>>>>>>>>> falling into their unit while no fire alarms or sprinklers were going off,
>>>>>>>>> burning embers falling from the ceiling and burner Joe’s face as a result
>>>>>>>>> of roofers trying to merely stomp the fire out, and more that we
>>>>>>>>> will withhold for our case. It should be noted that the fire was not more
>>>>>>>>> than mere feet from a sprinkler head. Baum is clearly in violation of the
>>>>>>>>> building code for failing to provide a working fire alarm, failing to
>>>>>>>>> provide working sprinklers, and failing to properly install fire doors with
>>>>>>>>> operable exit signs, as the firefighters could not find the signs through
>>>>>>>>> the smoke. Though a reasonable person would assume such an egregious
>>>>>>>>> situation could be easily handled without litigation, given Baum's constant
>>>>>>>>> refusal to take responsibility for its actions and our history it seems
>>>>>>>>> litigation is inevitable. Rowboat’s litigation attorney’s have been
>>>>>>>>> contacted as we continue to prepare to pursue action to the utmost degree
>>>>>>>>> against not only Matthew’s Roofing but also Baum Revisions.
>>>>>>>>>

Name: LG-VS-BAUM-162
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: Hi Lucas and Joe, Wanted to circled back on a few items we discussed last week. Sprinklers- I understand there was a previous discussion between you and David regarding changing out all of the
Email RTF:
Hi Lucas and Joe,

Wanted to circled back on a few items we discussed last week.

Sprinklers- I understand there was a previous discussion between you and David

regarding changing out all of the sprinkler heads in system 4 after the head

went off in September. In an effort to continue moving this process along,

Landlord is proceeding with changing out a total of 200 sprinkler heads in

system 4 for the total cost of $14,500. This work will begin Thursday, November

8th and it will take 5-6 business days to complete.

Restoration Cleaning- Please let me know when I can coordinate A Emergency to

come back into your space to complete the deep cleaning. We are unable to do

any further work until you advise us that they space is ready.

Doors- Pat, your architect, and Vatsal have had multiple discussions regarding

the doors in your space. I have been told they have agreed upon a plan and Pat

is now working on the drawing, and then Pat will coordinate the permit process.

Please keep us up to speed on his progress so we can proceed with the doors as

soon as they have been permitted.

Leaks- Please let me know if you experienced leaks from yesterdays rain. It

rained pretty strong and consistently all day. I'm making sure communication on

this is still open.

Kind Regards,

Name: LG-VS-BAUM-167
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: Hello team Baum, Thank you for the update and we confirm. However, our insurance provider would like to know why Great Lakes would only recommend replacing the system in 23A and not the entire system
Email RTF:
Hello team Baum,

Thank you for the update and we confirm. However, our insurance provider would

like to know why Great Lakes would only recommend replacing the system in 23A

and not the entire system in 23B, considering this is where the fire took

place? They have been on site to check in on progress of the clean up and claim

audit and were concerned as to the amount of dust and debris being cleaned up

from pipes/rafter that could have been caused by sandblasting. We just want to

ensure there is no potential for future malfunction of the heads caused by this.

Thank you and I look forward to hearing from you.

Name: LG-VS-BAUM-171
Subject: Re: 4200 W Diversey Fire
Body Snippet: Hi Joe and Lucas, Hope you had a good holiday and happy new year. I wanted to follow up with a few items regarding the clean up of your space and your doors. First, A-Emergency completed the full scope
Email RTF:
Hi Joe and Lucas,

Hope you had a good holiday and happy new year. I wanted to follow up with a

few items regarding the clean up of your space and your doors.

First, A-Emergency completed the full scope of cleaning and painting in space

23B last week and they're now done with their work. Currently, your items are

in the parking lot in a storage container from ServPro. Please have these

containers removed by the end of the month.

Lastly, as you know, Patrick and Vatsal have been discussing the suggested

revisions to the proposed plan for Rowboat's space and Patrick is submitting to

the city for approval. Patrick will keep all of us up to date with next steps.

Once we have final answers on what doors will be replaced, we can complete the

grinding and epoxy of the common hallway that leads to the Tripp hallway. Both

replacing doors and grinding floors could cause dust so we would like to

minimize the amount of days there could be dust by completing these items at the

same time. Again, we will have more answers once Patrick lets us know if the

drawings were approved.

If you have any questions, please let me know.

Kind Regards,

Subject: 4200 W Diversey Roof
Body Snippet: Dear Workshop 4200 Tenants, As some of you know, there was a fire on the roof of the building today. As you may also know, Matthews Roofing has been completing repairs and upgrades to the roof and
Email RTF:
Dear Workshop 4200 Tenants,

​

As some of you know, there was a fire on the roof of the building today. As you

may also know, Matthews Roofing has been completing repairs and upgrades to the

roof and windows over the past year. Today, while repairing a roof drain insert

with welding materials, a fire broke out and portion of the roof was damaged.

Matthews Roofing called 911 right away and fire and safety crews promptly

arrived on the scene to put out the flames.

​

We have been working with Matthews Roofing and the City of Chicago Fire

Department regarding today's incident and have been assessing damage resulting

from same. Safety is our number one priority and we're grateful that the Fire

Department was able to arrive quickly and manage the situation.

​

I'll continue to update as and if additional information needs to be shared, but

if you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

​

Kind Regards,

​

Rachel Knopp/ Director of Property Operations

rachel@baumrevision.com / Office: 312.275.6017 / Maintenance Requests:

312.471.1475

​

Baum Revision, LLC

1030 W Chicago Ave, Chicago IL, 60642

Body Snippet: Good Morning Rachel, Lucas + All, I would like to add that I was on-site yesterday when I smelled smoke in my space with all doors closed. Shortly thereafter, I noticed visible smoke in my space. I
Email RTF:
Good Morning Rachel, Lucas + All,

​

I would like to add that I was on-site yesterday when I smelled smoke in my space with all doors closed. Shortly thereafter, I noticed visible smoke in my space. I went out into the atrium to find firemen entering the building. Joe from Rowboat greeted them covered in dust because the roof caved in on him as the roofers were trying to stomp out the fire in Rowboat's storage space.

​

Letherbee's staff came to me out of valid concern as there is flammable alcohol in their space and Rowboat is their immediate neighbor. Management did not come on-site until after the firemen arrived. My main concern is the fact that Rowboat's entire storage space was filled with smoke, there was a live fire on their roof/ceiling, smoke was in my space and the shared hall and THERE WAS NO FIRE ALARM OR SPRINKLER ACTIVATED.

​

Rachel said that the building passed fire inspection, however as of yesterday's event, I feel that another inspection is warranted. These are our businesses and livelihood at stake of negligence. I feel that it is in our best interest, collectively, to make certain that precautionary measures are in place for what could be a potential disaster.

​

Sincerely,

​

Maria

Aaron's Reliable Inc.

Body Snippet: Hi Everybody, I'm sorry for such an upsetting event to happen in our building. It's extremely worrisome that we do not have a fire alarm or a fire detection system in place. If the roof caught
Email RTF:
Hi Everybody,

I'm sorry for such an upsetting event to happen in our building. It's extremely

worrisome that we do not have a fire alarm or a fire detection system in place.

If the roof caught fire so easily during a relatively wet fall week in Chicago

and we have no alarm systems in place, then safety for our spaces, our property

and for all tenants themselves is a concern. I hope this situation is

resolvable.

Thank you and have a good weekend,

Jyl

|Freight Summary 1 pcs |

|We appreciate you choosing Haul Bikes to care for your vehicle. We look |

|forward to working with you. Please validate that all information is correct. |

|If you see a problem, please let us know right away. |

|All shipments are routed for the most efficient delivery. Service times may |

|increase if there are restrictions in availability. Estimated timeframes are |

|found in the confirmation above. |

|Please ensure that your delivery and pick-up locations are ready for the |

|driver’s confirmation call. Our trucks are approximately 80-90 feet long. Our |

|trucks are restricted from going into gated communities, cul-de-sacs, military|

|bases, ports, and dead-ends and cannot travel down dirt or gravel roads. |

| |

|Occasionally the driver may determine that the delivery cannot be made safely |

|and/or legally to the address provided. Our drivers will make the final |

|decision on safety and may need to make alternate delivery or pick up options.|

|As such ensure that the delivery and pick-up location can accept the bike to |

|an alternate location if necessary. |

| |

|A thorough visual inspection is completed at the time of pickup. Bikes should |

|be prepped for shipping as drivers do not inspect or test any mechanicals |

|including batteries. Alarm systems will continue to have a small draw on the |

|battery during transport. Haul Bikes is not responsible to put the unit in |

|transport mode. Unit should be in transport mode before Haul Bikes arrives for|

|pickup. Haul Bikes will not be liable for battery failure or costs to replace |

|or repair batteries at the time of delivery. |

| |

|Pick-up and delivery are made seven days a week and on holidays. You will |

|receive your pickup window as soon as scheduled via email. You will receive a |

|call the day before delivery and pick-up from your driver with your assigned |

|window. Any unavailability must be provided immediately or attempt fees may |

|apply for failed deliveries or pick-ups of $250 each time. |

| |

|Thank you for your business and feel free to contact our service department |

|with any questions. |

transport mode. Unit should be in transport mode before Haul Bikes arrives for

pickup. Haul Bikes will not be liable for battery failure or costs to replace

or repair batteries at the time of delivery.

​

Pick-up and delivery are made seven days a week and on holidays. You will

receive your pickup window as soon as scheduled via email. You will receive a

call the day before delivery and pick-up from your driver with your assigned

window. Any unavailability must be provided immediately or attempt fees may

apply for failed deliveries or pick-ups of $250 each time.

​

Thank you for your business and feel free to contact our service department

with any questions.

Body Snippet: Hello, Your bike has been assigned to be picked up between the dates of 12/08-10 These dates cannot be moved as our truck is scheduled to be in your area during the window. Should there be any changes
Email RTF:
Hello,

​

Your bike has been assigned to be picked up between the dates of 12/08-10

​

These dates cannot be moved as our truck is scheduled to be in your area

during the window. Should there be any changes you will be notified via email.

​

The driver will contact the pickup location the evening prior to the pick-up to

advise of a more specific window of time for his arrival.

​

Please ensure that your pick-up location is ready for the driver’s confirmation

call. Your location must be able to accept an 80-foot customized tractor

trailer. We are unable to enter military installations, ports, gated

communities, cul-de-sacs, and dead-ends and cannot travel down dirt or gravel

roads. Our drivers will make the final decision on safety and may need to make

alternate delivery or pick up options. As such ensure that the pick-up contact

can move the bike to an alternate location if necessary. If this is the case,

you will need to move the bike to the alternate location.

​

A thorough visual inspection is completed at the time of pickup. Please ensure

that your bike is in transport mode if possible (for bikes that have alarm

systems). Daily Direct is not liable for a battery failure at the time of

delivery.

​

I am excited to begin this process with you. Please feel free to e-mail me if

you have any questions.

​

Again, thank you for your business!

​

Robyn

​

service@haulbikes.com

​

414-464-7576 ext. 2

I am sorry to hear about this damage. We will begin the claim process and ensure

this is taken care of.

for review.

us the damaged part(s)), email us at least 1 photo, and provide two written

estimates.

department for review.

Please let us know if you have any questions.

Thank you,

RC

All,

The bike was delivered yesterday with notable damage. I spoke with the

delivering driver for a long time which he noted on the report and directed me

to contact you directly.

We both reviewed the photos and video documentation and confirmed that none of

the damage seen yesterday was visible or noted on any documentation prior to

December 30th.

This bike was brought down from Chicago to CLT as it had the entire tank re-done

and painted. It now has damage to the tank, scrapes on the primary cover from

someone either dropping it or laying it down, and other damage.

Please contact me asap as this needs to be resolved. This is a shame as I have

used your services prior with not issues but this is clearly damage caused by

one of the drivers that occurred somewhere between the initial pickup and last

handoff.

We at Daily Direct, LLC/HAULBIKES sincerely apologize for the loss or damage that

​

occurred during your shipment. Unfortunately, a problem has developed during vehicle

​

transport. We fully understand your concern, distress and the inconvenience.

We will do everything we possibly can, within our guidelines, to correct the situation.

​

Please take a moment to read the attached information and understand the procedure of

​

how a damage claim is processed through our system.

​

When you have the required forms and information completed, please sign the agreement

​

and return it to Daily Direct, LLC/HAULBIKES.

​

Thank you for choosing Daily Direct and I hope we can once again service you in the

​

future.

Procedures for filing a claim for loss or damage:

​

• Page 3 of this documentation must be filled out and returned to the delivery driver

 upon delivery; failure to do so will result in the claim being rejected.

​

• Within 24 hours of delivery the following must be submitted to your customer

 service representative: Daily Direct Inspection Report received upon delivery, a summary outlining ‘said’ damage to the unit and pictures showing ‘said’ damage. If you are not sure how to contact your customer service representative please call the office at 888-428-5245.

​

• Daily Direct requests that two (2) written estimates be performed and e-mailed,

 faxed or mailed to Daily Direct within 14 days from the date of delivery. Estimates should be from respectful, known repair facilities.

​

• Any damaged part(s) that is and/or are being replaced with new component(s) will

 need to be shipped to Daily Direct at the claimant’s expense following completion of repair.

​

How a claim is processed:

​

     1\. Upon receipt of claim, shipments original paperwork will be compared with        claimant’s paperwork and estimates.     2\. Driver(s) will be interviewed to discuss said claim while paperwork and        estimates are being gathered.     3\. Claim will be reviewed by insurance company for determination.     4\. Claimant notified of determination by Daily Direct.     5\. Claim submitted to accounts payable if approved. Payment will be issued        within 30 days or less of claim being submitted to payables.

I, _______________________________________ have read and understand the attached

information explaining the procedures for filing a loss and/or damage claim, the flow of the

claim process through the company departments involved with said process. I agree that if

a part(s) that are damaged need to be removed and replaced with new component(s) that I,

myself, agree to ship the original damaged component(s) which are now the property of

Daily Direct, LLC/HAULBIKES to Daily Direct/HAULBIKES, 4600 North 124th Street,

Milwaukee, WI 53225 at my expense within 7 days of the repair being completed.

​

By signing this agreement, I understand the procedures and agree to the above terms.

Name: LG-VS-DDIR-128
Subject: Horrendous Daily Direct experience / action needed
Body Snippet: Hi Jeff, Your email was provided to me by several industry colleagues whom have been doing their best to aid through what has become a very unfortunate experience with your company. As a business owner
Email RTF:
Hi Jeff,

Your email was provided to me by several industry colleagues whom have been doing their best to aid through what has become a very unfortunate experience with your company. As a business owner myself, I have done all that I can to try and solve this matter amicably, professionally, and without immediately taking to BBB filings, negative reviews, or escalating legally as I understand the impact of these as an owner.

To elaborate on the current situation:

I have personally utilized Haul Biles / Daily direct on one previous occasion to ship my custom Ducati 800 from Chicago to Charlotte. You came highly recommended from several close acredited industry colleagues as they utilize your company on

a large basis. This first shipment was carried out flawlessly, even in the midst of the global pandemic which I was very pleased with.

I recently had a full custom bike from Analog Cycles

(http://analogmotorcycles.com) detailed in Chicago, as well as the tank fully repainted and restored. You can find pictures of this build here. This bike was completed and scheduled with your company in December to be delivered again to my home now in Charlotte. This bike was delivered to CLT on Jan 3 with notable damage. The delivering driver (Darryl) was more than helpful as we researched the photo logs which clearly showed the damage was not documented at the time of original pickup in Chicago. The damage taking place clearly while in the possession of Daily Directly between the first pickup and then relay to the final delivering driver. All photos were documented along with the drivers due diligence to record the damage. Again, NONE of this damage is noted or shown in “captured images / points of interest” recorded on 12/9 at 13:26 CST. All new damage was documented 12/30 10:23CST when the bike had already been in the possession of Haul Bikes for 21 days. See photos of damage attached to what was a brand new tank, in addition to scraped to the primary, and now leaking front

forks from over-compression.

I was instructed to follow protocol very closely which I absolutely did. Photos, records, and all information were provided to my sales rep (Jose Riewe) and your customer service within 24 hrs. After being asked a week later to sign a damage document that was original signed at drop-off, I was given approval by Robyn to have the original builder and team provide estimate for repair as this is a fully custom build which JUST had the tank fully repaired with proprietary paint. After submitting the formal estimate and following up with multiple phone calls and emails, still no response or instruction on how to rectify this issue.

Reaching frustration, I inquired with several industry colleagues and even previous employees of Daily Direct, I was instructed to discuss the matter with my legal and insurance provider as I will be met next by your Director of Operations whom will simply deny accountability very aggressively. After again

following up repeatedly I was instructed by legal and my insurance company to demand contact from a superior prior to executing legal action and subrogation.

Following a phone call to your customer service with these demands I received a call from Bob Kilmer (Director of Operations). What took place on this call was one of the most unprofessional experiences I have had as a business owner in my entire career. Not only was I confronted by a rude and aggressive Director of Operations, I was told I was blatantly lying about the damage. When I calmly stated the facts which had been supported by your delivering driver as well, I

was told by Mr. Kilmer that "if I was trying to get one over, he would replace the primary cover because I was obviously mad that I (personally) scratched it taking a turn too tight.” To be made to feel that I was in the wrong for damage

caused by your company to a one-of-a-kind collectors bike is beyond uncalled for. Following my response that I was simply trying to be proactive and solve this amicably as my legal and insurance wanted to step in, I was again met with unprofessional aggression which resulted in being told to “take me to court” by Mr. Kilmer and that the conversation was over. I professionally responded that I was more than equipped to do so, also noting that Daily Direct has a contractual obligation to make good on any damage claims once the contractual deductible is met. Not once was I informed how I could pay this or even next steps to resolve, instead I was made to feel like a criminal and told to “take you to court.”

Following the unprofessional call, I was forwarded the original Record 360 by Josh and Bob. I have followed up to this email on 3 separate occasions trying to solve this professionally and receive no response or calls.

To reiterate, I have been told by several current, ex-employees, and highly regarded industry colleagues that they have personally had similar, if not worse interactions with your Director of Operations. To be frank, a person such as

this has no place in your work force defacing the name of your company you have built. I have also done my own research to support both online in reviews, BBB filings, etc.

Lastly, I was told to reach out to you directly as you are very protective over your brand and company as an owner should. One of the providers of your direct email was in fact an ex-employee whom left Daily Direct due to his frustrations

with how Mr. Kilmer chose to operate. Quite a few industry folk noted they would have preferred to stay with Daily Direct had it not been for negative experiences with Mr. Kilmer. I say all this to say, I am simply doing my best to allow you, as the owner, to step in to do the right thing. My time is extremely valuable, as I know yours is. I have wasted countless hours being tied up in the middle of this in the midst of welcoming a newborn to my family. It is now two months into not having my finished bike, which will now require further time to be fixed. I absolutely am not one for threats but I will conclude by saying that I am more than prepared to escalate this matter if fully forced to. Beyond

breach of contractual obligations, I would prefer for the several extremely accredited builders, paints, etc to walk away from this not feeling negatively about their client having this experience per their referral, but that you stepped in to do the right thing.

I appreciate your time and consideration and hope this resonates from business owner to business owner. I eagerly await your response to determine next steps.

Thank you Jeff.

​

notes: First LG starts with the "everyone says that you are the worst..." to put the victim on the defensive to reach LG's desired effect.

Jeff,

I was advised to refuse all communication. This will be my last correspondence without agreement of the below and legal will take over:

My frustration is an understatement and to be honest I am not keen on formulating a solve that simply behooves you from spending the necessary money to have the repairs done by the original builder and painter. work. I can easily avoid any further run around and let legal and my insurance provider argue with you over repair cost from the original vendor.

I have very explicitly, and in repetition, stated the damage that must be fixed.

Here listed yet again:

• Honda factory choke cable must be replaced due to delivery damage (See attached from estimate)

• front fork repair (see attached from estimate) - damaged from over compression and now leaking

• damage to rear of front headlight repaired due to transport damage

• left primary cover repaired due to transport damage

• scratches to brand new tank caused by transport damage

Beyond your agreement to have the above fully restored to my final approval, we are demanding the following as well:

• All repairs above to be completed by April 23, 2021.

• Pickup and delivery expenses of damaged bike will be covered by you on all sides

• I will be overnighted a check upon executed agreement for $450 (refund in full for services initially rendered by Haul Bikes)

• If damages are not repaired to my full approval, you agree that the bike will be returned to original builder and painter to complete. You will incur all necessary expenses with transport, repairs, paint, storage etc (This was previously agree to by you on record).

• Bike must fully run upon final delivery to me for repairs inspection.

At this point, my time is way more valuable elsewhere as I would like to imagine yours is as well. This will be the last attempt to rectify this situation and I can assure you the other side of this will be a largely different financial demand.

Please advise.

Body Snippet: Pamela, I am sorry I am just responding now I have attempted to work this out with your client. I wanted to ensure I found the best people in his area to complete the issues at hand. We have been
Email RTF:
Pamela, I am sorry I am just responding now

I have attempted to work this out with your client. I wanted to ensure I found the best people in his area to complete the issues at hand. We have been threatened from the first conversations with legal action against my company and when you start with conversations that go directly to Legal action you become very cautious as to how you handle things moving forward. After your client had his initial conversation with my staff things did not go well leading to an email to me. I responded to your client and thought we had a very good conversation and direction as to what was agreed to and how we would proceed.

It took some extra time to find the proper people to ensure the quality of work that I wanted done to your clients bike. That extra time caused your client to become more frustrated and I can understand that and again was told legal action

would be taken. I outlined what I would agree to fix in the bike based off the pictures received. The black scuff marks on the gas tank were not there when we picked the bike up.

I told you client that I would send out a master detailer who was also a paint specialist to attemp to buff out the tank, if the tank could not be buffed out we would pay to have it sent back to his painter... I have owned the largest refurbishing paint center in the state of Wisconsin for 28 years.. I know paint, we do paint jobs that cost in excess of $25,000 so I felt very comfortable knowing these marks based on my background would buff out. I also agreed to replace the scraped derby cover and have it powder coated.. that's all I agreed to...

The headlight marks are clearly from the the brakeline that goes across the headlight. Have him show you the photos, the fork chips in the paint were all there upon inspection at the pick up and the fork seals were never in his original estimate for repairs..

Then in his final demand he stated the the bike must run to his liking, I have nothing to do with how his bike runs or the mechanical operation of his bike.. that's when it was extremely obvious we were never going to come to terms...

​

Counselor your going to do whatever it is your going to do and I will respond based off of how you handle this situation, if you want to agree to what I have already offered let's proceed, if not you will do what you do. None of us win in court but when you reach a situation where you dont see a resolve sometimes it's the only option.

​

If you would like to discuss this with me further. Please feel free to call me at 414 702 4643 at any time.

Best Regards,

​

Jeff

Body Snippet: Here is response: Jeff, It is clear that you and your team continue to deflect the responsibility and damage your are clearly responsible for. My client has made it very clear in his previous response
Email RTF:
Here is response:

Jeff,

It is clear that you and your team continue to deflect the responsibility and damage your are clearly responsible for.

My client has made it very clear in his previous response to you that his motorcycle is currently running and in operating condition. The stipulation of this being included was merely to protect him from receiving a bike that no longer runs after sitting for countless days while being repaired.

Your indication that the damage to the headlight being from “brake lines” is absolutely false. I have reviewed your initial documentation at the time of pickup and this is not included. Your self-appointed professionals will deem this as explicit damage into the paint. Again, this has been explained time and

again from my client.

It was also made clear to you on several occasions that my client was not asking for paint chips to be repaired on the motorcycles forks. Please refrain from including this in your argument further.

Lastly, the damage that occurred from your team during transport to the fork seals is clearly indicated in the estimate originally submitted to your team. As it seems none of your team has thoroughly researched this incident even after

months upon months. The fork damage repair is cited and begins on the bottom of page 2 of the estimate submitted to you. We have chosen to not include this is our repair demands.

I will remind you again that you are clearly in breach of your contractual obligation as my client has followed your seemingly loose protocol in detail and yet no action has been taken by you, your insurance provider, or your company.

Based on numerous legal complaints on file for your company it seems that the continued circular arguments to exhaust your customers is a common practice. I can assure you that this case will not disappear and has also been fully approved for subrogation against your insurance company, in addition to our

escalated legal action should we need to proceed in that direction. I will urge you that it is in your best interest to resolve this issue with the below as any other action will have far greater monetary impact due in part to legal costs and pursuit of additional damages / expenses.

The request remains the same to rectify this situation:

• The tank damage will be repaired

• The scraped primary cover on left side of the back will be fully repaired / re-powder coated

• The bike will be returned in the same working status as it is picked up for repairs. (Video documentation will be recorded showing bike in working condition)

• Damage to paint on the back of front headlight will be repaired

• My client will receive a check re-funding him the full amount he has paid to Haul Bikes for this transport order.

** as you previously agreed, my client will have final review to ensure the

damages are repaired and restored to status prior to Haul bikes’ damage.

Please advise within 24-48hrs as we will expect contact from your master detailer within 7 business days to schedule next steps and bike pickup.

Thank you.

​

_______________________________

Lucas Guariglia

Name: LG-VS-DDIR-177
Subject: CLAIM 0626547251 (Lucas Guariglia)
Body Snippet: Hello, I am writing to follow up on a damage claim recently placed. Damage occurred to a personal motorcycle during transit from Chicago to Charlotte while in possession of a company hired called Haul
Email RTF:
Hello,

I am writing to follow up on a damage claim recently placed. Damage occurred to a personal motorcycle during transit from Chicago to Charlotte while in possession of a company hired called Haul Bikes / Daily Direct.

I have tried to solve this issue amicably and professionally with the company directly and was met with threats and intimidation to “Take them to court.” I even paid for added insurance which would require a deductible to be paid should any damage occur. I was never presented with the opportunity to even pay this but was instead verbally accused of causing the damage myself. The matter was finally escalated to the owner of the company whom admitted to fault on record multiple times. He agreed to pay for the damage, refund what I paid for the

botch service, and assured me it would be taken care of. Five months later after excuses and no action, I was forced to retain council. The owner (Jeff Lloyd) continued to admit fault and that he would made good on the damage and then ultimately refused to return calls or emails from myself or my attorney.

This case was then handed over to Allstate to subrogate. It is now over 6 months that I have been in possession of a damaged bike that was previously completely restored prior to Haul Bikes picking the bike up and damaging several elements

of it.

I am prepared to supplied any correspondence, paper trail, and track record that clearly shows no prior damage to pickup from Haul Bikes. I have followed all protocol exactly as instructed by Haul Bikes, only to be met with aggressive unprofessional demeanor.

This incident has also been filed with the Bureau of Better Business (BBB) and I am awaiting response for next steps from them.

Please advise as to next steps in subrogation and anything that can be done to expedite this matter.

Thank you in advance!

Attached are photos of the damage which were also uploaded through the claims app / link I was provided. Full estimate from the builder was also provided to Haul Bikes as they requested to repair damage caused in transport.
Attachments: 2021-05-27T07-42 [lucas@rowboatcreative.com] CLAIM 0626547251 (Lucas Guariglia) - File Complaint against Haul Bikes | Better Business Bureau.pdf

​

We are currently awaiting completion of a supplement review of damage. Once this supplement has been completed Allstate will pursue Haul Bikes for any damage that we paid to assist you with the repairs as well as your deductible amount.

We can only subrogate for funds paid under your policy for repairs as well as the deductible amount. We will use all resources available to us to complete this recovery but some times it can take some time for us to receive a response.

​

Feel free to reach out to us for any other questions or concerns.

Thank you!

> > > Hello,

> > > I am writing to follow up on a damage claim recently placed. Damage

occurred to a personal motorcycle during transit from Chicago to Charlotte while

in possession of a company hired called Haul Bikes / Daily Direct.

> > >

> > > I have tried to solve this issue amicably and professionally with the

company directly and was met with threats and intimidation to Take them to

court. I even paid for added insurance which would require a deductible to be

paid should any damage occur. I was never presented with the opportunity to even

pay this but was instead verbally accused of causing the damage myself. The

matter was finally escalated to the owner of the company whom admitted to fault

on record multiple times. He agreed to pay for the damage, refund what I paid

for the botch service, and assured me it would be taken care of. Five months

later after excuses and no action, I was forced to retain council. The owner

(Jeff Lloyd) continued to admit fault and that he would made good on the damage

and then ultimately refused to return calls or emails from myself or my

attorney.

> > >

> > > This case was then handed over to Allstate to subrogate. It is now over 6

months that I have been in possession of a damaged bike that was previously

completely restored prior to Haul Bikes picking the bike up and damaging several

elements of it.

> > >

> > > I am prepared to supplied any correspondence, paper trail, and track

record that clearly shows no prior damage to pickup from Haul Bikes. I have

followed all protocol exactly as instructed by Haul Bikes, only to be met with

aggressive unprofessional demeanor.

> > >

> > > This incident has also been filed with the Bureau of Better Business (BBB)

and I am awaiting response for next steps from them.

> > >

> > > Please advise as to next steps in subrogation and anything that can be

done to expedite this matter.

> > >

> > > Thank you in advance!

> > >

> > > Attached are photos of the damage which were also uploaded through the

claims app / link I was provided. Full estimate from the builder was also

provided to Haul Bikes as they requested to repair damage caused in transport.

> > >

> > >

> > >

Name: LG-VS-DDIR-194
Subject: Re: Complaint D 15478890
Body Snippet: Hi Stacy, hope you are well, I received response yesterday through BBB that is absolutely false. Please see response and supporting documents that was included in my rejection. Haul Bikes response was
Email RTF:
Hi Stacy, hope you are well,

I received response yesterday through BBB that is absolutely false. Please see response and supporting documents that was included in my rejection.

Haul Bikes response was that the Owner / CEO has been in communication with me which is beyond false. He has refused action and response in both email form and phone calls from me personally, as well as legal council. Here was my response

through BBB portal:

​

As supported in the attached screen shots of correspondence from not only myself, but my attorney as well, the Owner / CEO Jeff Lloyd continually refused action after agreeing to repair the damages and refund the charges for the botched delivery service. You will see my council requested response several

times and Mr. Lloyd refused response, as well as phone calls. There have been a multitude of complaints against Haul Bikes for this same situation and they repeatedly refuse action. They are also in breach of contract as they contractually charge for insurance coverage should damage occur. Not ONCE was I,

or my council, offered option or process to initiate a claim. We were informed by former employees that their insurance coverage is a scam and they never make good on damage claims, instead pocket the coverage funds.

​

Finally, the very fact that we have documented evidence of the Owner / CEO stating he would refund the charges paid to the company and refusing to do so should be reason alone to continue escalation of this matter. We have received no communication to either myself our council for months now and certainly no compensation for repairs or losses. We have been forced to file an insurance claim to repair the damages which will be surrogated to the utmost degree. No consumer should be treated this way nor should a company be allowed to operate supply paying customers with false information and promise. P

lease escalate this matter and project potential future consumers from falling victim.

​

Thank you.

​

What more can be done at this point to protect other consumers from this fraud and treatment?
notes: LG contacts WI BBB to ruin owner. LG will not stop until the victim is destroyed.

Dear Lucas Guariglia,​Thank you for submitting a complaint with The Department of Agriculture, Trade and Consumer Protection. You can use the complaint PIN below to check the status of your complaint on the MyDATCP website. It can take up to 24 hours for a complaint to be available online.​This is your PIN that you can use to check the complaint status:7e6ac606152021120116​General Consumer Complaint​Complaint PIN: 7e6ac606152021120116

Your InformationSalutation Mr.First Name LucasLast Name GuarigliaCell Phone (847) 828-0944Email lucas@rowboatcreative.com

Phone me between 8-4 at CellBest time to callInformation about the person or business your complaint is against:Business Name Haul Bikes / Daily DirectAddress Line 1 4600 N 124th StCity MilwaukeeState WIZip 53225-4300Business Phone (414) 464-7576Email jlloyd62@sbcglobal.netWebsite https://haulbikes.comPhone (414) 702-4643

Name of the person you talked to Jeff Lloyd

Title of the person you talked to Owner / CEO

Your Complaint

Haul Bikes / Daily direct services were hired to transport my newly refurbished motorcycle from Chicago to Charlotte. The bike was heavily damaged during transport while in possession of Haul Bikes. When the bike finally arrived to me, I completed proper protocol to report the damages. No action was taken to

rectify the situation and I was verbally threatened. I was able to involve the owner whom initially was proactive in rectifying the situation while openly admitting fault in writing several times. After continued delay, I was forced to hire an attorney in hopes of resolution. Again the owner admitted fault but refused to make good on repairs. At NO point was I offered the option to pay the insurance deductible which was additional coverage I paid for. My attorney and I have been told by former employees of Haul Bikes that the insurance coverage is a scam where no damage is ever repaired and the company pockets the additional coverage. I demand a full refund ($450) + $250 for insurance deductible as I was forced to file a personal claim which will be subrogated. I am happy to provide all correspondence which includes the owner Jeff Lloyd's refusal to provide legal contact or communication with my attorney after openly admitting fault.

There has also been a formal complaint filed with the Bureau of Better Business which has also seen the company's refusal of action after agreeing to refund payment, as well as repairing damages they caused. Previous employees have warned of their operations and how they treat consumers even after admitting guilt.

Name: LG-VS-DDIR-211
Subject: RE: Daily Direct LLC 118328
Body Snippet: Dear Lucas Guariglia, As was explained in my previous letter, our agency has no administrative authority regarding transactions between residents of other states and companies located in Wisconsin
Email RTF:
Dear Lucas Guariglia,

​

As was explained in my previous letter, our agency has no administrative authority regarding transactions between residents of other states and companies located in Wisconsin unless the transaction actually occurred in Wisconsin. Your

complaint has been recorded into Daily Direct LLC’s file and will be used to track unfair business practices. We do not disclose whether or not a business is under further internal investigation.

​

I did receive a message from the business, which I have attached to this email.

​

Please know the Bureau of Consumer Protection cannot force a resolution, cannot offer legal advice or act as a private attorney. Consumer Protection also cannot determine who is telling the truth in a dispute of facts. If your complaint is not resolved to your satisfaction, you may consider:

​

1. Discussing your complaint with a private attorney.

2. Taking action in small claims court.

​

As the transaction took place in Illinois, I advise you contact their Attorney General and/or Consumer Protection offices.

​

Sincerely,

​

Nolan Stracke

​

Consumer Protection Investigator – Mediation Unit

​

Bureau of Consumer Protection

​

Wisconsin Department of Agriculture, Trade and Consumer Protection

​

Office: (608) 224-4921

​

Cell: (608) 866-0130

​

Nolan.Stracke@Wisconsin.gov

​

Please complete this brief survey to help us improve our customer service.

Thank you for your feedback!
labels: LG Contacts DATCP claims fraud, Daily direct, MacUncle_December 17, 2023 6:46 PM/121723data-13-5KNV9m/121723data--lucas@rowboatcreative.com-5KNV9m.mbox

Body Snippet: Hi Eliana, We are looking forward to Manufacturing Day tomorrow. Do you have a final count of student participants that you can share with Rowboat Creative? I have copied Lucas who is your main contact
Email RTF:
Hi Eliana,

​

We are looking forward to Manufacturing Day tomorrow. Do you have a final count of student participants that you can share with Rowboat Creative? I have copied Lucas who is your main contact there. We look forward to welcoming 20-25 students first at Wilbur Wright, then you will head to Rowboat Creative for lunch and a tour of their facility.

​

Attached is the bus shuttle, with contact info and scheduled pick up/drop off.

The bus should be at Clemente HS by 9:00AM. I will join your tour and be your main point of contact that day 773-837-0024.

Hi Eliana,

​

Great news! Yes, we will definitely include Clemente’s participation in

Manufacturing Day 2018.

transport you back to your school by 2:00 PM.

Name: LG-VS-STUDENT-108
Subject: Re: Final Details: Manufacturing Day 2018
Body Snippet: All, At this point I am not certain whom has been updated as to today's occurrence at Rowboat Creative during our hosting of Mfg. Day. What occurred today was absolutely inexcusable. To have been
Email RTF:
All,At this point I am not certain whom has been updated as to today’s occurrence at Rowboat Creative during our hosting of Mfg. Day.What occurred today was absolutely inexcusable. To have been personally and physically threatened in our place of business and MY company both while employees and clients are present is beyond anything I have ever experienced in 12 years since establishing Rowboat Creative. Not only did the tour arrive late, but started with the students rudely rushing into our premises and continuing to ransack our front lobby demanding “where is the food?!”, and helping themselves to our employee refrigerator and sample show pieces. At no point did any present adult chaperones or representatives interfere or try to regain order to the situation aside from my partner and I. In the interest of the program and day, we chose to move on the best we could which progressed somewhat productively until our employees and myself beganprepping to distribute pizza’s (which we incurred expense for). At this time, students began taking full pizzas for themselves and rudely refusing to place the food on the table for everyone to take from in an organized fashion when asked. As we began to collect the full pizza boxes from the students, one refused to comply after asking nicely repeatedly. This student then continued to physically slap my hand and push me out of the way when an attempt was made to remove the pizza cordially. Again, absolutely no chaperones or supervisors did anything to involve themselves, reprimand, or calm the situation. The student then continually threatened me. It was at this time that we asked the student tobe removed from our premises. Again no assistance we given until theconfrontation began to escalate further. Once the student was finally escorted out, multiple other students were overheard saying that they were willing to "start a riot" and “turn this place upside down.” It was at this time that we chose to end the day and escort all parties to our entrance to exit the premises. Beyond the glaring ridiculous of the situation, Rowboat Creative has always gone over and above to be part of programs such as Mfg. Day. We are vendors for CPS, and engage with the City of Chicago to assist in creating job opportunity in any way we can. Not only were we willing to incur the cost of the bus expense, as well as provide lunch for the entire program, but we also welcomingly took timeout of our day to accommodate and hopefully inspire the City’s next generation of creators and manufacturer’s. I, on behalf of Rowboat Creative are exceptionally let down by how the situation was handled and ashamed that this is a representation of Mfg Day and Roberto Clemente. We are very strong proponents of Mfg Day and the message the programcan send to the youth when coupled with Rowboat Creative. We certainly expected more and are very sorry to have experienced this occurrence.

Lucas Guariglia

cell: 847.828.0944

office: 773.675.BOAT (2628)

president | designer | director of sales operations

​

Rowboat Creative

custom screen printing | embroidery | merchandising

​

ASI: 83710

​

www.rowboatcreative.com

https://www.instagram.com/rowboat_creative
notes: I believe Lucas put this together and then forgot to tell me about the entire event until the day of. I wound up putting together a demonstration and speech together while Lucas got the pizzas. Some of the students were rowdy. Email RTF:
EMAIL SUBJECT: Re: Final Details: Manufacturing Day 2018

​

Lucas

​

I am so sorry this happened. Rowboat Creative has been a very generous supporter Manufacturing Day and what happened today is completely unacceptable. It is very unfortunate that one group of students has given Mfg Day such a negative reputation.

​

I have added the other members of the Mfg Day planning team to this email so they are also aware of the situation that took place today.

​

Please extend our deepest apologies to the Rowboat Creative team.

​

John

​

Sent from my iPhone

​

> On Oct 20, 2018, at 2:51 AM, Lucas G <lucas@rowboatcreative.com> wrote:

>

> All,

> At this point I am not certain whom has been updated as to today’s occurrence at Rowboat Creative during our hosting of Mfg. Day.

>

> What occurred today was absolutely inexcusable. To have been personally and physically threatened in our place of business and MY company both while employees and clients are present is beyond anything I have ever experienced in 12 years since establishing Rowboat Creative.

>

> Not only did the tour arrive late, but started with the students rudely rushing into our premises and continuing to ransack our front lobby demanding “where is the food?!”, and helping themselves to our employee refrigerator and sample show pieces. At no point did any present adult chaperones or representatives interfere or try to regain order to the situation aside from my partner and I.

>

> In the interest of the program and day, we chose to move on the best we could which progressed somewhat productively until our employees and myself began prepping to distribute pizza’s (which we incurred expense for). At this time, students began taking full pizzas for themselves and rudely refusing to place the food on the table for everyone to take from in an organized fashion when asked. As we began to collect the full pizza boxes from the students, one refused to comply after asking nicely repeatedly. This student then continued to physically slap my hand and push me out of the way when an attempt was made to remove the pizza cordially. Again, absolutely no chaperones or supervisors did anything to involve themselves, reprimand, or calm the situation. The student then continually threatened me. It was at this time that we asked the student to be removed from our premises. Again no assistance we given until the confrontation began to escalate further. Once the student was finally escorted out, multiple other students were overheard saying that they were willing to "start a riot" and “turn this place upside down.” It was at this time that we chose to end the day and escort all parties to our entrance to exit the premises.

>

> Beyond the glaring ridiculous of the situation, Rowboat Creative has always gone over and above to be part of programs such as Mfg. Day. We are vendors for CPS, and engage with the City of Chicago to assist in creating job opportunity in any way we can. Not only were we willing to incur the cost of the bus expense, as well as provide lunch for the entire program, but we also welcomingly took time out of our day to accommodate and hopefully inspire the City’s next generation of creators and manufacturer’s.

>

> I, on behalf of Rowboat Creative are exceptionally let down by how the situation was handled and ashamed that this is a representation of Mfg Day and Roberto Clemente. We are very strong proponents of Mfg Day and the message the program can send to the youth when coupled with Rowboat Creative. We certainly expected more and are very sorry to have experienced this occurrence.

>

> --

Subject: Re: Final Details: Manufacturing Day 2018
Body Snippet: Hello Members of the Manufacturing Day planning team, Rowboat Creative Owner, and Clemente Administration, Please forgive my late respond as it has been a very busy week at Clemente. After reviewing
Email RTF:
Hello Members of the Manufacturing Day planning team, Rowboat Creative Owner, and Clemente Administration,

​

Please forgive my late respond as it has been a very busy week at Clemente. After reviewing the email sent by Rowboat Creative and speaking with the Wilbur Wright host/trip chaperones, I feel as if the situation described in the previous email is very harsh.

​

Our students had a wonderful time learning about how they can further their education in this field. I noticed that much of the description in the previous email is very one sided. Please allow me to explain what our chaperones/Wilbur Wright host shared. A trip chaperone mentioned this incident occurred during the FINAL 20 MINUTES of the trip and everything prior was a calm experience. It was also stated that an employee of Rowboat Creative put their hand on a CPS student which triggered the situation. I assure you that one of the three chaperones immediately removed the student outside of the premises as a means to deescalate the situation. However, I would hope that an adult putting their hands on a student does not go unnoticed.

​

When the tour ended 6 pizzas were brought out and the students were told that they can share a pizza between four students since there were 22 of them in the group. While students had already started distributing pizza they were then told distribution of the pizzas would happen a different way. In the midst of recollecting the pizza, the incident with the Rowboat Staff member and Clemente student happened. I will be clear that this was ONE student out of 22 that attended this trip.

​

I am not defending the actions of this student because upon return to the school he was reprimanded, but I do not find it fair to judge the entire group, while tarnishing our school's name, for one student's action. Especially if there were

reasons for him being triggered in the Rowboat Creative business. If this means anything, please remember they are teenagers full of energy, still learning, and they had not eaten since breakfast (for some the night prior).

​

IF Rowboat Creative decides to partake in anything like this in the future, I encourage them to further their knowledge on inner city/urban public schools and the populations they service. It can help them make a decision on whether or not they want to sign up.

​

We completely understand if they no longer want to work with Clemente because quite frankly I do not want my students around a business that allows their staff members to put their hands on their visitors.

​

To the members of the manufacturing day committee, we appreciate the exposure you allowed our students to gain for their post secondary plans. If you have any other questions for me please do not hesitate to reach out.

​

Eliana Triche-Lebrón

College and Career Coach

Roberto Clemente Community Academy

1147 N. Western

773.534.4075 (p)

773.534.4003 (f)

etriche@cps.edu

​

​

PRIVILEGE AND CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: The information contained in this communication may be confidential, is intended only for the use of the recipient(s) named above, and may be legally privileged. If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution, or copying of this communication, or any of its contents, is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you have received this communication in error, please return it to the sender immediately and delete the original message and any copy of it from your computer system.

Body Snippet: Good morning, Lucas. Thank you for sharing your thoughts about the situation during Manufacturing Day. I, too, was aghast at the reply you received from Clemente. Clearly, there should be follow up. I
Email RTF:
Good morning, Lucas.​Thank you for sharing your thoughts about the situation during Manufacturing Day. I, too, was aghast at the reply you received from Clemente. Clearly, there should be follow up.​I would recommend we talk with Dee Dee Jones and Leslye Long who run the Manufacturing Connect programs at Austin, Bowen and Prosser High Schools. I have had the great pleasure of working with them for several years and havealways been impressed with the professionalism, knowledge and enthusiasm with which they run their programs. The staff at Austin is doing more than just teaching the basics of manufacturing. They are also working with the studentson the 'intangibles' of being a good person as well as a top professional.​Let's let Dee Dee and Leslye weigh in on the current situation and listen to their recommendations for next steps and follow up. I trust them implicitly and I have full confidence that the appropriate strategies will be developed and implemented to alleviate the stress of the current situation.​I truly appreciate the opportunity to work for and with you. You and Joe are absolutely in the upper 1% of all of the manufacturers with whom we work.​John​From: Lucas G <lucas@rowboatcreative.com>To: John Azara <jazara@imec.org>, caitlin cummings<cummingsgncdc@gmail.com>Cc: John Bradarich <jbradarich@imec.org>, "Vanessa Uribe (Bureau ofEconomic Development)" <Vanessa.Uribe@cookcountyil.gov>, Joe Zangrilli<joe@rowboatcreative.com>, Jenny Uribe <juribe@gncdc.org>Date: 10/22/2018 07:12 AMSubject: Re: Final Details: Manufacturing Day 2018​
